connected_entities: Jekyll Island meeting (1910): Nelson Aldrich, Paul Warburg, Frank Vanderlip, Henry Davison
Wall Street banks: Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase, Citigroup (major influence)
Federal Reserve Bank of New York: Executes open market operations, closest to Wall Street
Board of Governors: Presidential appointees with banker backgrounds
Treasury Department: Coordination on fiscal and monetary policy
Bank for International Settlements: Central bank coordination
BlackRock: Asset management firm with Fed contract for bond purchases
SWIFT system: International payment infrastructure controlled via Fed participation
Primary dealers: 24 banks authorized to trade directly with Fed
Ron Paul: Persistent Fed critic, 'Audit the Fed' legislation advocate
Bloomberg News: Forced disclosure of 2008 emergency lending via lawsuit
network_type: Financial control hub with government-private hybrid governance
